competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the correct training for waste collection operations using tail lifting equipment?

competencies.name: Operative operates the tail-lift in accordance with manufacturerâ€™s instructions
Operative ensures that when the tail-lift is lowered into position the platform is level with the ground
Operative ensures that that a stable and level platform is achieved prior to loading being attempted
Operative uses edge protection when provided
Operative enters and exits the rear of the vehicle by standing on the tail-lift and operating the controls to raise or lower the platform
Operative ensures that self and others are not put at risk of injury when operating the tail-lift
Operative ensures that the tail-lift platform is level with the floor of the vehicle before loading or unloading
Operative uses load restraint flaps on the tail-lift for items that may move
Operative applies brakes to wheeled containers once they have been safely placed on the tail-lift
Operative ensures that the contents of the vehicle are securely restrained to avoid movement in transit
Operative ensures that the tail-lift, edge protection, load restraint flaps and power leads and all other items are safely stowed and secured before driving off
Operative takes care to note kerbs, steps, potholes, uneven paving and other trip hazards
Operative keeps ground in view as far as is practicable and conducts checks where vision is lost before proceeding
Operative takes extra care in dark, wet and icy conditions
competencies.supportingText: 1. What action should be taken to avoid or control adverse effects of wet or icy ground /floor conditions underfoot?

competencies.name: Operative always wears protective footwear issued by the company
Operative checks the weight of item before lifting and only lifts items within own capability
Operative asks for assistance if load is heavy or awkward
competencies.supportingText: 1. Which types of load could require assistance when moving?

competencies.name: Operative gets a firm grip on the load before lifting and ensures a firm footing
Operative lifts with one foot in front of the other and with knees bent using leg muscles to achieve the lift
Operative exercises care when moving loads which restrict sight of the ground, steps or obstructions in front
Operative exercises care when manually handling items in wet and icy conditions
competencies.supportingText: 1. What action should be taken to avoid or control adverse effects of wet or icy ground /floor conditions underfoot?
